text: When hacking Julia Base, how do I disable the system image so I don't have to recompile it all the time? Or is that the wrong workflow?

elements.text: When hacking Julia Base, how do I disable the system image so I don't have to recompile it all the time? Or is that the wrong workflow?

text:
if you don't have a huge amount of changes, I suggest doing
```@eval Base begin
....
end```

elements.text: if you don't have a huge amount of changes, I suggest doing

text: Oh sure. I meant more when prepping a Julia PR, so I like to actually change the source files, with version control etc. My term "hacking" wasn't chosen wisely :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: Oh sure. I meant more when prepping a Julia PR, so I like to actually change the source files, with version control etc. My term "hacking" wasn't chosen wisely

text:
Thanks - this is for <https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/pull/40025>, I constantly need to restart Julia there (since it's about Julia startup), so Revise won't help in this special case.

Isn't there a way to run without sysimg (with longer startup time, of coure)?
